text.p: Lithuania's parliament on Monday approved the 1997 budget, which has a deficit of 697.85 million litas.
Parliament backed the budget by 74 votes in favour, 18 against and 20 abstentions in the 141-seat parliament.
The budget set the limit for foreign loans next year at 2.472 billion litas. The major revenue source is planned from VAT at 3.425 billion litas and 1.24 billion litas from excise duties.
"The most difficult part is to fulfill this revenue part, which has been drawn up pretty optimistically," Finance Minister Rolandas Matiliauskas told Reuters.
"The budget is stretched but we could not succeed in doing more in such a short period," Matiliauskas added.
The new right-wing government of Prime Minister Gediminas Vagnorius increased the deficit in the 1997 budget, a previous version of which was drawn up by the former government of ex-Communists.
The previous deficit was some 100 million litas smaller than the one passed by parliament today.
